00028 #if !defined(_SPANDSP_GSM0610_H_)
00029 #define _SPANDSP_GSM0610_H_
00030 
00031 /*! \page gsm0610_page GSM 06.10 encoding and decoding
00032 \section gsm0610_page_sec_1 What does it do?
00033 
00034 The GSM 06.10 module is an version of the widely used GSM FR codec software
00035 available from http://kbs.cs.tu-berlin.de/~jutta/toast.html. This version
00036 was produced since some versions of this codec are not bit exact, or not
00037 very efficient on modern processors. This implementation can use MMX instructions
00038 on Pentium class processors, or alternative methods on other processors. It
00039 passes all the ETSI test vectors. That is, it is a tested bit exact implementation.
00040 
00041 This implementation supports encoded data in one of three packing formats:
00042     - Unpacked, with the 76 parameters of a GSM 06.10 code frame each occupying a
00043       separate byte. (note that none of the parameters exceed 8 bits).
00044     - Packed the the 33 byte per frame, used for VoIP, where 4 bits per frame are wasted.
00045     - Packed in WAV49 format, where 2 frames are packed into 65 bytes.
00046 
00047 \section gsm0610_page_sec_2 How does it work?
00048 ???.
00049 */
00050 
00051 enum
00052 {
00053     GSM0610_PACKING_NONE,
00054     GSM0610_PACKING_WAV49,
00055     GSM0610_PACKING_VOIP
00056 };
00057 
00058 /*!
00059     GSM 06.10 FR codec unpacked frame.
00060 */
00061 typedef struct
00062 {
00063     int16_t LARc[8];
00064     int16_t Nc[4];
00065     int16_t bc[4];
00066     int16_t Mc[4];
00067     int16_t xmaxc[4];
00068     int16_t xMc[4][13];
00069 } gsm0610_frame_t;
00070 
00071 /*!
00072     GSM 06.10 FR codec state descriptor. This defines the state of
00073     a single working instance of the GSM 06.10 FR encoder or decoder.
00074 */
00075 typedef struct gsm0610_state_s gsm0610_state_t;
00076 
00077 #if defined(__cplusplus)
00078 extern "C"
00079 {
00080 #endif
00081 
00082 /*! Initialise a GSM 06.10 encode or decode context.
00083     \param s The GSM 06.10 context
00084     \param packing One of the GSM0610_PACKING_xxx options.
00085     \return A pointer to the GSM 06.10 context, or NULL for error. */
00086 SPAN_DECLARE(gsm0610_state_t *) gsm0610_init(gsm0610_state_t *s, int packing);
00087 
00088 /*! Release a GSM 06.10 encode or decode context.
00089     \param s The GSM 06.10 context
00090     \return 0 for success, else -1. */
00091 SPAN_DECLARE(int) gsm0610_release(gsm0610_state_t *s);
00092 
00093 /*! Free a GSM 06.10 encode or decode context.
00094     \param s The GSM 06.10 context
00095     \return 0 for success, else -1. */
00096 SPAN_DECLARE(int) gsm0610_free(gsm0610_state_t *s);
00097 
00098 /*! Set the packing format for a GSM 06.10 encode or decode context.
00099     \param s The GSM 06.10 context
00100     \param packing One of the GSM0610_PACKING_xxx options.
00101     \return 0 for success, else -1. */
00102 SPAN_DECLARE(int) gsm0610_set_packing(gsm0610_state_t *s, int packing);
00103 
00104 /*! Encode a buffer of linear PCM data to GSM 06.10.
00105     \param s The GSM 06.10 context.
00106     \param code The GSM 06.10 data produced.
00107     \param amp The audio sample buffer.
00108     \param len The number of samples in the buffer.
00109     \return The number of bytes of GSM 06.10 data produced. */
00110 SPAN_DECLARE(int) gsm0610_encode(gsm0610_state_t *s, uint8_t code[], const int16_t amp[], int len);
00111 
00112 /*! Decode a buffer of GSM 06.10 data to linear PCM.
00113     \param s The GSM 06.10 context.
00114     \param amp The audio sample buffer.
00115     \param code The GSM 06.10 data.
00116     \param len The number of bytes of GSM 06.10 data to be decoded.
00117     \return The number of samples returned. */
00118 SPAN_DECLARE(int) gsm0610_decode(gsm0610_state_t *s, int16_t amp[], const uint8_t code[], int len);
00119 
00120 SPAN_DECLARE(int) gsm0610_pack_none(uint8_t c[], const gsm0610_frame_t *s);
00121 
00122 /*! Pack a pair of GSM 06.10 frames in the format used for wave files (wave type 49).
00123     \param c The buffer for the packed data. This must be at least 65 bytes long.
00124     \param s A pointer to the frames to be packed.
00125     \return The number of bytes generated. */
00126 SPAN_DECLARE(int) gsm0610_pack_wav49(uint8_t c[], const gsm0610_frame_t *s);
00127 
00128 /*! Pack a GSM 06.10 frames in the format used for VoIP.
00129     \param c The buffer for the packed data. This must be at least 33 bytes long.
00130     \param s A pointer to the frame to be packed.
00131     \return The number of bytes generated. */
00132 SPAN_DECLARE(int) gsm0610_pack_voip(uint8_t c[], const gsm0610_frame_t *s);
00133 
00134 SPAN_DECLARE(int) gsm0610_unpack_none(gsm0610_frame_t *s, const uint8_t c[]);
00135 
00136 /*! Unpack a pair of GSM 06.10 frames from the format used for wave files (wave type 49).
00137     \param s A pointer to a buffer into which the frames will be packed.
00138     \param c The buffer containing the data to be unpacked. This must be at least 65 bytes long.
00139     \return The number of bytes absorbed. */
00140 SPAN_DECLARE(int) gsm0610_unpack_wav49(gsm0610_frame_t *s, const uint8_t c[]);
00141 
00142 /*! Unpack a GSM 06.10 frame from the format used for VoIP.
00143     \param s A pointer to a buffer into which the frame will be packed.
00144     \param c The buffer containing the data to be unpacked. This must be at least 33 bytes long.
00145     \return The number of bytes absorbed. */
00146 SPAN_DECLARE(int) gsm0610_unpack_voip(gsm0610_frame_t *s, const uint8_t c[]);
00147 
00148 #if defined(__cplusplus)
00149 }
00150 #endif
